This is because the planets were thought to wander through the sky in ancient times.

* The etymology of "quale" is uncertain, but it is possibly derived from the Latin word "qualis", meaning "of what kind". * The etymology of "più" is also uncertain, but it is possibly derived from the Latin word "plus", meaning "more". * The etymology of "degno" is derived from the Latin word "dignus", meaning "worthy". * The etymology of "con" is derived from the Latin word "cum", meaning "with". * The etymology of "lei" is derived from the Latin word "illa", meaning "she". * The etymology of "ti" is derived from the Latin word "tibi", meaning "to you". * The etymology of "lasciare" is derived from the Latin word "laxare", meaning "to loosen". * The etymology of "in + il" is derived from the Latin phrase "in + ille", meaning "in the". * The etymology of "mio" is derived from the Latin word "meus", meaning "my". * The etymology of "partire" is derived from the Latin word "partire", meaning "to depart".
